summary: This document details an interview conducted with Steven Hoffenberg on October 12, 2010, regarding Jeffrey Epstein and the murder of Arthur L. Shapiro. Hoffenberg refused to answer questions without a court-appointed attorney present and referred the agents to external sources for information.

persons.name: Steven Hoffenberg
persons.context: Hoffenberg was interviewed by FBI agents and refused to answer questions about Epstein and Shapiro without legal representation.

persons.name: Arthur L. Shapiro
persons.context: Shapiro is mentioned in relation to the murder investigation that Hoffenberg declined to discuss.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is referenced in the document but not directly involved in the interview.

persons.name: Anthony Robert DiPietro
persons.context: DiPietro is identified as the agent who drafted the communication regarding Hoffenberg's interview.

persons.name: Frank W. O'Neill
persons.context: O'Neill is mentioned as the approving agent for the interview documentation.

events.title: Interview of Steven Hoffenberg
events.description: FBI agents interviewed Steven Hoffenberg regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Arthur L. Shapiro.

keyFacts: Steven Hoffenberg refused to answer questions about Jeffrey Epstein and Arthur L. Shapiro without a court-appointed attorney.
Hoffenberg referred agents to a March 2003 Vanity Fair article and a website, Tower Investors.com.
He mentioned having pending civil matters against the Bureau of Prisons.
The interview concluded without Hoffenberg providing any information regarding Epstein or Shapiro.
